meanings.definition: A type of inflorescence in which the main axis is elongated and the flowers are sessile.
meanings.sent1: The coremia of the plant had beautiful flowers growing directly from the main stem.
meanings.sent2: The florist arranged the coremia of the bouquet to create a stunning display.
meanings.sent3: The coremia of the garden seemed to be showing off its lovely blooms to the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The coremia of the flower arrangement stood tall and proud, like a leader among the blooms.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the coremia of that plant, with its unique and elegant floral structure.

meanings.definition: The central part of a plant from which leaves or flowers arise.
meanings.sent1: The coremia of the tree was strong and sturdy, supporting the growth of the branches.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully nurtured the coremia of the plant to ensure healthy leaf development.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel made a cozy nest in the coremia of the bush, much to the gardener's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The coremia of the flower seemed to reach towards the sun, as if yearning for its warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The coremia of the plant was like a bustling city, with leaves and flowers bustling with life and activity.

meanings.definition: A type of floral arrangement in which the flowers are clustered at the top of the stem.
meanings.sent1: The florist created a stunning coremia for the wedding centerpiece, with flowers elegantly clustered at the top.
meanings.sent2: The coremia of the bouquet added a touch of elegance with its clustered flowers at the top.
meanings.sent3: The coremia of the floral display looked like a colorful crown atop the plant's stem.
meanings.sent4: The coremia of the arrangement was like a beacon of beauty, drawing all eyes to its clustered blooms.
meanings.sent5: The coremia of the plant was a delightful surprise, with its vibrant flowers clustered at the top like a floral crown.
